fp_11.png.question: What is the subject of the Office Memorandum?
fp_11.png.answer: Revision of rates of Dearness Allowance to Central Government employees effective from 01.01.2023.

fp_11.png.question: What does the term "Basic Pay" in the revised pay structure mean?
fp_11.png.answer: The pay drawn in the prescribed Level in the Pay Matrix as per 7th CPC recommendations accepted by the Government, but does not include any other type of pay like special pay, etc.

fp_11.png.question: How will the payment on account of Dearness Allowance involving fractions of 50 paise and above be counted?
fp_11.png.answer: rounded to the next higher rupee

fp_11.png.question: Who will these orders apply to?
fp_11.png.answer: These orders shall apply to the civilian employees paid from the Defence Services Estimates and the expenditure will be chargeable to the relevant head of the Defence Services Estimates. In respect of Armed Forces personnel and Railway employees, separate orders will be issued by the Ministry of Defence and Ministry of Railways respectively.

fp_11.png.question: What is considered for the persons serving in the Indian Audit and Accounts Department?
fp_11.png.answer: these orders are issued in consultation with the Comptroller and Auditor General of India, as mandated under Article 148(5) of the Constitution of India.

fp_11.png.question: What is the new rate of Dearness Allowance?
Will the Dearness Allowance be treated as pay within the ambit of FR 9(21)?
fp_11.png.answer: No, the Dearness Allowance will continue to be a distinct element of remuneration and will not be treated as pay within the ambit of FR 9(21).

fp_11.png.question: Who will issue separate orders for Armed Forces personnel and Railway employees?
fp_11.png.answer: Separate orders will be issued by the Ministry of Defence and Ministry of Railways respectively.
